name: Roscoe Shelton
description: '''Roscoe Shelton''' (August 22, 1931 – July 27, 2002) was an American [[electric blues]] and [[rhythm and blues|R&B]] [[singing|singer]]. He is best remembered for his 1965 [[hit single]] "Strain on My Heart" and for his working relationships with the [[The Fairfield Four|Fairfield Four]] and with [[Bobby Hebb]]. Other notable recordings include "Think It Over" and "Baby Look What You're Doin' to Me". Fred James, who [[record producer|produced]] much of Shelton's later work, noted that Shelton moved effortlessly into [[soul music]], unlike many of his 1950s blues and R&B recording contemporaries.
